title: Add SKShapeView: MAUI shapes rendered via SkiaSharp
body:
**Description of Change**

Adds `SKShapeView`, a canvas control that accepts MAUI `Shape` children and renders them with SkiaSharp. XAML-first design similar to WPF/UWP Canvas—define shapes declaratively, everything flattens to pixels.

**New types:**
- `SKShapeView` — Canvas control with `Children` collection and `Left`/`Top` attached properties
- `GeometryExtensions` — MAUI geometry → `SKPath` (ellipse, rect, line, path, arc segments, beziers, etc.)
- `BrushExtensions` — MAUI brush → `SKPaint` (solid, linear gradient, radial gradient, stroke/dash)

**Supported:**
- All MAUI shapes: Rectangle, RoundRectangle, Ellipse, Line, Polyline, Polygon, Path
- All transforms: Rotate, Scale, Skew, Translate, Composite, TransformGroup, Matrix
- Stroke: thickness, dash patterns, line caps, line joins, miter limit
- Per-shape opacity

```xml
<skia:SKShapeView HeightRequest="200">
    <shapes:Rectangle 
        skia:SKShapeView.Left="10" skia:SKShapeView.Top="10"
        WidthRequest="80" HeightRequest="60"
        Fill="CornflowerBlue" Stroke="DarkBlue" StrokeThickness="2" />
    <shapes:Ellipse 
        skia:SKShapeView.Left="100" 
        WidthRequest="80" HeightRequest="80"
        Fill="{StaticResource GradientBrush}" />
</skia:SKShapeView>
```

See `documentation/maui-shape-api-comparison.md` for full MAUI/WPF/UWP coverage matrix.

**Bugs Fixed**

None — new feature.

**API Changes**

Added:

- `SKShapeView` — View implementing `ISKCanvasView`
- `SKShapeView.LeftProperty`, `SKShapeView.TopProperty` — attached properties
- `SKShapeView.Children` — `IList<Shape>`
- `GeometryExtensions.ToSKPath(Geometry)`, `GeometryExtensions.ToSKPath(Shape)`
- `BrushExtensions.ToSKPaint(Brush, SKRect)`, `BrushExtensions.ToSKStrokePaint(...)`
- `BrushExtensions.ToSKStrokeCap(PenLineCap)`, `BrushExtensions.ToSKStrokeJoin(PenLineJoin)`

**Behavioral Changes**

None.

**Required skia PR**

None.

**PR Checklist**

- [ ] Has tests (MAUI workloads unavailable in CI; sample page added for manual verification)
- [x] Rebased on top of main at time of PR
- [x] Merged related skia PRs
- [x] Changes adhere to coding standard
- [x] Updated documentation

<details>

<summary>Original prompt</summary>

> I want to add a feature to skiasharop for maui where people can just drop in the skcanvasview and then drop in maui geometry or shapes and use that to draw. Same with brusehs. If the user drops in xaml controls as children of a canvas, it should DRAW that control using the brushes and styles and animations of maui. We want to effectively suppoert maui geometry and shanpes as children in xaml. This should be a xaml first design where we imitate the xaml canvas conterols of WPF andUWP. We can put any geometry in there. At the end, there is just a canvas with pixels at a color and not layers of nested things.


</details>
